title: Self Activity: Import Your Own Data

sections.content: This hands-on activity helps you practice importing real business data into Zoho CRM. You'll learn to properly map fields, handle duplicates, and validate your import results.

items: Access to Zoho CRM with import permissions
Your business data in CSV or Excel format
Understanding of your data structure and field requirements

sections.content: Before importing, ensure your data file is properly formatted:

items: Export your existing data from your current system (spreadsheet, email list, or other CRM)
Review the data for any formatting issues, duplicates, or missing required fields
Make sure column headers match CRM field names where possible
Save the file in CSV or Excel format

sections.content: Navigate to the appropriate module in Zoho CRM and start the import process:

items: Click the **Import** button in your target module (Leads, Contacts, Deals, etc.)
Upload your prepared data file
Carefully map each column from your file to the corresponding CRM field
Pay special attention to required fields (marked with asterisks)
Use **Lead Source**, **Owner**, or other tracking fields to identify this import batch

sections.content: **Pro Tip:** Create a custom field like "Import Batch" or use tags to track which records came from this specific import.

items: Choose how to handle duplicates (skip, update, or merge)
Select the duplicate check criteria (email, phone, company name, etc.)
Decide whether to trigger workflows and assignment rules
Set the record owner (yourself or distribute among team members)
Review the field mapping summary
Check the preview of how your data will appear
Click **Import** to begin the process
Wait for the import completion notification

sections.content: After your import completes, verify the results:

items: Check the import summary report for any errors or skipped records
Create a custom view or filter to see only your newly imported records
Verify that key fields populated correctly (names, emails, phone numbers, etc.)
Look for any data quality issues that need cleanup
Test that the records are searchable and accessible

sections.content: Consider these questions after completing your import:

items: How many records imported successfully? Were there any errors?
What data quality issues did you discover during the import?
How could you improve your data file before the next import?
What field mappings were challenging? Why?
Did you use tags or custom fields to track this import batch?

sections.content: Now that you've imported your data:

items: Set up workflows to automate actions on these records
Create reports and dashboards to track your imported data
Train your team on working with the new records
Plan regular data quality audits to maintain accuracy
